bill_title: provide for a conservation easement for certain state lands.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for a conservation easement for certain state lands. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. If the federal government conveys the fee title of any land to the State of South Dakota, the state may reconvey the fee title to another party if the land is no longer used or needed by the state. However, the state shall hold a perpetual conservation easement to protect the public interest in preserving the historical, architectural, archaeological, paleontological, and cultural aspects on the land when the fee title is conveyed to another party. The conveyance documents shall specify the conversation easement and the conservation easement shall be made in accordance with § § 1-19B-56 to 1-19B-60, inclusive. Section 2. The State of South Dakota, when exchanging land pursuant to § 5-3-7 or selling land pursuant to chapter 5-9, may hold a perpetual conservation easement preserving the historical, architectural, archaeological, paleontological, and cultural aspects on such land to protect the public interest. The conveyance documents shall specify the conversation easement, if any, and the conservation easement shall be made in accordance with § § 1-19B-56 to 1-19B- 60, inclusive. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for a conservation easement for certain state lands. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. If the federal government conveys the fee title of any land to the State of South Dakota and that land is under the management of the Office of School and Public Lands, the Office of School and Public Lands may reconvey the fee title to another party if the land is no longer used or needed by the state. However, the state shall hold a perpetual conservation easement to protect the public interest in preserving the historical, architectural, archaeological, paleontological, and cultural aspects on the land when the fee title is conveyed to another party. The conveyance documents shall specify the conservation easement and the conservation easement shall be made in accordance with § § 1-19B-56 to 1-19B-60, inclusive. Section 2. The State of South Dakota, when exchanging land pursuant to § 5-3-7 or selling land pursuant to chapter 5-9, may hold a perpetual conservation easement preserving the historical, architectural, archaeological, paleontological, and cultural aspects on such land to protect the public interest. The conveyance documents shall specify the conservation easement, if any, and the conservation easement shall be made in accordance with § § 1-19B-56 to 1-19B- 60, inclusive. BILL HISTORY 1/11/00 First read in Senate and referred to State Affairs. S.J. 16 1/14/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/17/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/19/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/19/00 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 9, NAYS 0. S.J. 108

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for a conservation easement for certain state lands. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. If the federal government conveys the fee title of any land to the State of South Dakota and that land is under the management of the Office of School and Public Lands, the Office of School and Public Lands may reconvey the fee title to another party if the land is no longer used or needed by the state. However, the state shall hold a perpetual conservation easement to protect the public interest in preserving the archaeological and paleontological aspects on the land when the fee title is conveyed to another party. The conveyance documents shall specify the conservation easement and the conservation easement shall be made in accordance with § § 1-19B-56 to 1-19B-60, inclusive. Section 2. The State of South Dakota, when exchanging land pursuant to § 5-3-7 or selling land pursuant to chapter 5-9, may hold a perpetual conservation easement preserving the archaeological and paleontological aspects on such land to protect the public interest. The conveyance documents shall specify the conservation easement, if any, and the conservation easement shall be made in accordance with § § 1-19B-56 to 1-19B-60, inclusive.
